citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The semi-annual report, submitted to the Institutional Official in the fall of 2023, did not include signatures from the
majority of the IACUC members or any minority views. The last semi-annual facility inspection and program review were
completed on October 12, 2023, however, the report was submitted without review and signatures from the majority of the
IACUC members.
Every six months, upon completion of the program review and facility inspection, the IACUC must provide reports of its
evaluations to the Institutional Official to ensure that they are aware of the current status of the animal program, facilities,
and procedures. It's important for a majority of the IACUC members to review and sign the reports to ensure that the
findings are consistent with the assessments of the IACUC members and that all minority views are included.
After completing the program review and the inspection of the animal facilities, the IACUC must prepare reports of their
evaluations and submit the reports to the Institutional Official. The reports shall be reviewed and signed by a majority of
the IACUC members and must include any minority views.
Correct by December 13, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
